intro: Tauscheria lasiocarpa, commonly known as the woolly tauscheria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Tauscheria lasiocarpa is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
